reasoning: ZASP-related myofibrillar myopathy is an extremely rare genetic muscle disorder caused by ZASP gene mutations. Myofibrillar myopathies collectively are estimated at <1 per 100k prevalence, with ZASP mutations representing a small fraction. Using prevalence for this lifelong genetic condition. Very limited epidemiological data; mostly case reports and single-center cohorts.
source: Selcen D. (2011). Myofibrillar myopathies. Neuromuscul Disord. 21(3):161-71
